name: Introduction to Communication Studies
description: This course introduces students to the major concepts in communication studies, including interpersonal communication, group communication, and mass communication.

name: Health Communication
description: This course explores how communication shapes and is shaped by health-related issues, including public health policy, biomedical research, and health care organizations.

name: Public Health Policy
description: This course examines the history, development, and implementation of public health policy, with a focus on the role of health communication in policymaking.

name: Biomedical Research
description: This course explores how communication is used in biomedical research, including ethical considerations, the role of language in research, and the communication of research findings.
